items.title: How I Built A $1M/Year Business - And Helped My Parents Retire

ai.summary: Based on the available description, Tuan Le emigrated from Vietnam to Toronto in 2015 at age 15 and vowed to help his parents retire. Ten years later his social video production company, ShortsCut, brings in over $1 million USD a year in sales, and he now pays his parents' rent and living expenses so they no longer have to work full time.
bullets: Tuan Le emigrated from Vietnam to Toronto in 2015 at age 15 and vowed to help his parents retire.
He founded ShortsCut, a social video production company.
ShortsCut generates over $1M USD in annual sales.
Tuan now covers his parents' rent and living expenses so they no longer work full time.
The video was produced by CNBC Make It.
takeaways: Social video production can scale to seven-figure annual revenue, indicating a sizable market of content businesses to monitor.
Growing digital media companies represent potential steady customers for service providers and capacity planners.
Decision-makers should consider outreach and product offerings tailored to small-to-medium creative firms that scale rapidly.
Success stories from immigrant founders highlight diverse sources of demand and partnership opportunities in the creative sector.
